name: Premier Inn Newbury / Thatcham

reviews.text: This hotel has a main building and an annex and is separated from the road by good use of a grassy expanse and trees. The car park is cramped but sheltered. We stayed in the main building above reception where there are no lifts but our room was spotless, warm and quiet.
reviews.title: Rural setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very friendly and quick to provide me with an extra supply of (real) milk, on request.
reviews.title: Ideal for a couple of nights

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We noticed creaky floorboards right outside our room door and thought we may be kept awake by guests walking past but that never occurred; a peaceful night!
reviews.title: Our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Continental breakfast in the restaurant next door is to be recommended. Again we found very friendly staff, a huge variety of good food to choose from and fast service.
reviews.title: No frills but no complaints

reviews.text: An evening meal was not so good as we found the Sunday roast was unavailable in the evening. The chosen alternative of steak and ale pie seemed to be a good excuse to hide poor meat in pastry and the ham in the pea & ham soup could only be found as specks. The restaurant had a friendly, busy atmosphere, however.
reviews.title: A brief stay for one night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night over the Easter bank holiday and had a buffet breakfast. Following advice from other reviewers we asked for, and got, a room at the back/side of the hotel away from the noise of the front and main road. We enjoyed a quiet, restful, night in an adequate, clean room that we booked at the special offer price.
reviews.title: Good Value ; Great Service.

reviews.text: The staff in the hotel and next door in the pub were very accomodating and friendly and the food selection and quality on the continental buffet was very good. Premier Inns, in our experience, do offer good, consistent standards and the staff try hard to please. This was no exception.
reviews.title: Business stop.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Another trip away and another premier Inn. Arrived a bit earlier than expected but this was no problem for the receptionist. Dealt with my booking very efficiently and with a smile! For the first time ever I was offered extra coffee and tea for my room if needed. I was offered an evening booking but this was not needed as they were not that busy and I fancied an early dinner anyway.
reviews.title: No heating!

reviews.text: Room up to the usual standard. The restaurant next door was excellent. They took my order and presented the food 'piping hot' which I love. Three courses all excellent food and enough for me to eat.
reviews.title: Refurb needed BUT restaurant is a gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was just as good, the full English was presented and the plate was spotless, the presentation was brilliant, and hot. Plenty of coffee and I was on my way.
reviews.title: Comfortable night's sleep

reviews.text: Despite the fact that this hotel was quite empty when I stayed (they told me when I checked in), I was allocated a really noisy room above some kind of kitchen fan. It wasn't just noisy - it vibrated with the fan.
reviews.title: Worst Premier Inn I've ever been to!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I requested a change and was led to a room that was so baking hot, it was like a sauna. Eventually, they found a third empty room but for that, I had to walk all my luggage over to an annex.
reviews.title: Impressed...

reviews.text: I usually love Premier Inn breakfasts but this one wasn't up to scratch. For example, the supposedly "freshly baked croissants" (according to the menu), were sitting unappetisingly in their polythene wrappers. Yoghurts weren't the advertised brand. The fresh fruit didn't look too fresh and so on.
reviews.title: Simply superb
What you would expect
reviews.text: I really wouldn't recommend this place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from 2 nights at the Thatcham Premier Inn. Very impressed with the level of service and customer care. Polite, pleasant and professional. Yes, rooms are a little bit tired, but clean, comfortable and tidy. We stayed in room 1, which was massive! Staff are incredibly polite and we will be putting a trip advisor review on separately about The Berkshire Arms (the best pub and food we have had in a long, long time). If you are planning a stay in this area, and want a good, clean, tidy hotel, this is the one, but make sure that you dine in the pub - you will enjoy the food and experience.
reviews.title: Good night

reviews.text: very friendly staff and atmosphere. rooms as you would expect from a premier inn. Food in the restaurant very good. Enjoyed our stay Slept well. Surrounding area lovely countryside. Near where we needed to get to.
reviews.title: enjoyed the stay
Not near, Newbury!!
reviews.text: Stayed whilst on business in Newbury, should have read the reviews as the hotel is a 30 minute drive from Newbury at rush hour! Room was fine, others have commented on the tired appearance but I have certainly stayed in worse Premier Inns!!!had a meal at the pub which was lovely, as was breakfast in the morning. Slept well and didn't hear any noise like other reviews have referred to. wouldn't stay again but only because of location, too far away from Newbury for me, would have rated it higher otherwise as certainly fine for a nights stay :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Usually impressed with the value for money at premier inn, but very dissapointed with this one. Shabby, dirty and generally worn out. Seemed deserted and only saw one member of staff who although pleasant wasnt exactly helpful. Whole experience was dreary and couldn't wait to leave.
reviews.title: dissapointed

reviews.text: We will think twice before booking another premier inn
reviews.title: Another Premier, but not the best of the bunch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All Premier Inns are virtually identical and this is no exception. But the Premier Inn Newbury/Thatcham isn't one of the best, as it's looking a little tired and in need of some refurbishment. Oddly rooms are poorly sound insulated, to the extent that you can clearly hear when someone is coughing in the room next door - disturbing! Staff are however very pleasant and helpful and rooms are very clean.
reviews.title: Great hotel

aka: Premier Inn Newbury / Thatcham Hotel Newbury
